items.sentence: Tom wasn\'t able to do what we asked him to do.
Tom wasn\'t able to read until he was thirteen.
Tom wasn\'t expecting to see Mary at the party.
Tom wasn\'t supposed to go to Boston with Mary.
Tom wasn\'t sure whether he should sing or not.
Tom drank a glass of milk and went back to bed.
Tom drank the shot of tequila down in one gulp.
I\'m sorry, but I don\'t have any small change.
I\'m sorry, but I don\'t want to talk about it.
I\'m sorry, but your names aren\'t on the list.
Why didn\'t you tell me you could speak French?
Tom thought that it would be fun to go sailing.
Tom thought that nobody knew what he was doing.
Tom told Mary that everything would be perfect.
Tom told Mary that he could predict the future.
Tom never bothered to learn the local language.
Tom said he wanted to take some pictures of us.
I\'m thinking of buying a house on Park Street.
I\'m trying to learn as much as I can from Tom.
He told me that his grandfather is over ninety.
